name: unbound
description: Unbound is a high-performance, validating, caching DNS resolver focused on security and privacy. It runs as a daemon on servers and devices and is configured via files and CLI tools.
features: Recursive resolver: Resolve DNS queries by querying authoritative servers directly without forwarding.
DNSSEC validation: Validate DNSSEC signatures to ensure DNS responses are authentic and unmodified.
Caching: Cache DNS responses to improve performance and reduce query latency for repeated lookups.
Privacy-focused: Query root servers directly to avoid exposing DNS queries to third-party resolvers.
High performance: Handle thousands of queries per second with efficient caching and threading.
Access control: Define which clients can query the resolver using IP-based access lists.
DNS-over-TLS: Support encrypted DNS queries using DNS-over-TLS for privacy protection.
Local zones: Define local DNS zones for internal network resolution and custom overrides.
Forwarding: Optionally forward specific domains to designated DNS servers for split-horizon setups.
Statistics: Monitor query statistics and cache performance through built-in reporting.
Lightweight: Run efficiently with minimal memory and CPU usage suitable for embedded devices.
Configuration files: Configure all settings through text files for version control and automation.
